NCES NEHS 2019

children.Rd

The National Household Education Surveys Program (NHES), the flagship household survey program of the National Center for Education Statistics, collects nationally representative, descriptive data on the educational activities of children and families in the United States. NHES surveys are conducted every three to four years, on various topics. The current NHES topics are early childhood care and education, family involvement in schools, and homeschooling.

Usage

children

Format

children

A data frame with 7092 rows and 50 columns:

unique_id

Unique identifier for each record.

child_dob

Month and year of birth of the child.

child_sex

Sex of the child.

child_race_ethnicity

Race/ethnicity of the child.

child_language

Primary language spoken by the child.

child_health_status

Health status of the child, as described by their parent.

child_disability

Indicates if the child has a disability.

child_speech_impairment

Indicates if the child has a speech impairment.

child_autism

Indicates if the child has autism.

child_developmental_delay

Indicates if the child has a developmental delay.

child_ifsp_iep

Indicates if the child has an IFSP (Individualized Family Service Plan) or IEP (Individualized Education Program).

child_letter_recognition

Indicates if the child can recognize letters (NA for children under 2).

child_name_writing

Indicates if the child can write their name (NA for children under 2).

child_counting_ability

Indicates the child's counting ability (NA for children under 2).

child_num_books

Approximate number of books the child has.

read_to_child

Frequency of reading to the child in the last week.

crafts_with_child

Frequency of doing crafts with the child in the last week.

child_library_visit_week

Indicates whether a family member has visited a library with the child in the last month.

child_bookstore_visit_month

Indicates whether a family member has visited a bookstore with the child in the last month.

child_learns_online

Indicates the frequency with which the child uses the internet for learning activities.

parent1_relationship

Relationship of the first parent to the child.

parent1_birthplace

Birthplace of the first parent.

parent1_education

Education level of the first parent.

parent1_employment

Employment status of the first parent.

parent1_age

Age of the first parent.

parent2_status

Indicator of a second parent in the child's life.

parent2_relationship

Relationship of the second parent to the child, if applicable.

parent2_birthplace

Birthplace of the second parent, if applicable.

parent2_education

Education level of the second parent, if applicable.

parent2_employment

Employment status of the second parent, if applicable.

parent2_age

Age of the second parent, if applicable.

household_size

Number of people in the household.

household_income

Income level of the household.

household_program_benefits

Indicates if, in the last year, the household has received benefits from their state's welfare or family assistance program; Women, Infants, and Children (WIC); SNAP benefits or food stamps; Medicaid; Child Health Insurance Program (CHIP); or housing assistance through a voucher or Section 8.

household_internet_access

Indicates what type of internet access the household has, if any.

hh_adults_language

Languages spoken by adults in the household.

census_region

Census region where the household is located.

regular_relative_childcare

Indicates if the child receives regular childcare from relatives.

relative_care_type

Which relative is providing the childcare, if applicable.

relative_care_days

Number of days per week the child receives relative childcare.

relative_care_cost_weekly

Weekly cost of relative childcare.

regular_nonrelative_childcare

Indicates if the child receives regular childcare from non-relatives.

nonrelative_care_days

Number of days per week the child receives non-relative childcare.

nonrelative_care_cost_weekly

Weekly cost of non-relative childcare.

regular_program_childcare

Indicates if the child attends a regular childcare program.

program_care_location

Location of the childcare program, if applicable.

program_care_teach_religion

Indicates if the childcare program teaches religion, if applicable.

program_care_days

Number of days per week the child attends the childcare program.

program_care_cost_weekly

Weekly cost of the childcare program.

survey_completion_mode

Mode of survey completion (e.g., online, in-person).

Source

https://nces.ed.gov/nhes/
